hadiths.english_translation: From his uncle from the Prophet ﷺ who said: There is no tithe (ushr) upon the Muslims. Rather, the tithe is upon the Jews and Christians. Abu Nu'aym related it from Sufyan from 'Ata ibn al-Sa'ib. Ibn Mahdi said: A man from Banu Bakr. Musaddad said: From Abu al-Ahwas from 'Ata from Harb ibn Ubaidullah from his grandfather Abu Umayyah from his father from the Prophet ﷺ. Ahmad ibn Yunus said: From Abu Bakr from Nusayr from 'Ata from Harb ibn Hilal al-Thaqafi from Abu Umamah from Taghlob who heard the Prophet ﷺ, and similar. Musa said: From Hammad ibn Salamah from 'Ata from Harb ibn Ubaidullah from a man from his uncles who heard the Prophet ﷺ, not supported. Abu Abdillah said: The Prophet ﷺ ordained the tithe from what the earth produces in five wasqs. Abu Hamzah said: From 'Ata, Hashim al-Thaqafi told us that his father informed him, and he was among those who came as a delegation to the Prophet ﷺ, I said to the Prophet ﷺ.

hadiths.english_translation: He heard from his father from his grandfather Jabir ibn Samura who said: Umar appointed Sa'd and appointed my father over Medain. This was said by Ali from Zaid ibn al-Habab.

narrators.name: Ali
narrators.full_name: Ali ibn Muhammad or unidentified Ali

narrators.name: Harb ibn Khalid
narrators.full_name: Harb ibn Khalid ibn Jabir ibn Samura

chainIssues: Ali at the beginning is majhul al-hal and unidentified
Khalid ibn Jabir is majhul with no clear biographical information
Harb ibn Khalid is majhul and unidentified
This is a mawquf hadith attributed to Jabir ibn Samura, not the Prophet ﷺ
